metadata.title: CVE-2023-6546 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the GSM 0710 tty multiplexor in the Linuxkernel. This issue occurs when two threads execute the GSMIOC_SETCONF ioctlon the same tty file descriptor with the gsm line discipline enabled, andcan lead to a use-after-free problem on a struct gsm_dlci while restartingthe gsm mux. This could allow a local unprivileged user to escalate theirprivileges on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-5.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic - 5.15.0-91.101
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-91-generic-64k - 5.15.0-91.101
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1
linux-image-6.2.0-39-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-39.40~22.04.1
